content.question:
Ming is learning the game of tennis and will practice serving a tennis ball within bounds. Assume that the probability of Ming serving a tennis ball within bounds is <math alttext="0.40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.40</mn></math> and that her serves are independent of each other.
What is the probability that the first time Ming serves a tennis ball within bounds will occur on her <math alttext="fourth" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mtext>th</mtext></math> attempt?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 minus open parenthesis, 0.4, close parenthesis, to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.4</mn><msup><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 choose 1, times 0.4, times open parenthesis, 0.6, close parenthesis, cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.6</mn><msup><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 choose 1, times 0.4, times open parenthesis, 0.6, close parenthesis, cubed, plus 4 choose 2, times open parenthesis, 0.4, close parenthesis, squared, times open parenthesis, 0.6, close parenthesis, squared, plus 4 choose 3, times open parenthesis, 0.4, close parenthesis, cubed, times 0.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.4</mn><msup><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.6</mn><msup><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.4</mn><msup><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
